name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
On July 19, it was reported that a Spring Airlines flight attendant posted an insulting statement to passengers online saying "anything can take a plane, summer travel is for shabi transport".
In response, Spring Airlines customer service responded that they attach great importance to this matter and are currently investigating it urgently in accordance with the principle of seeking truth from facts. A spokesperson will respond later.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Starting in mid-June, a "big comment movement" swept through China's social media comment sections. People put aside their concerns and began to speak freely about the current social situation. Why did the Chinese suddenly dare to speak out after nearly three decades of Internet control? This episode brings you the history of Internet censorship in China and why it began to collapse.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
Recently, camel owners in the Mingsha Mountain Scenic Area in Dunhuang, Gansu Province, went on strike collectively.
It is said that the Cultural Tourism Group takes 40% of the commission every day, so everyone has to rely mainly on taking photos of tourists and collecting tips to make money, 20 per person.
But now taking photos is also prohibited...so the collective strike has been going on for more than ten days.
On July 19, the scenic area refuted the rumor that it was not a strike, but because the wind was too strong and the camel path was blown away.

content:
Netizen contribution
Recently, following Guangdong, Harbin traffic police also began to catch electric bikes on the streets.
In the video, the takeaway boy asked with a slightly tearful voice why his electric bike was confiscated when it clearly complied with national regulations. No response was received.
During the process, an older traffic police stopped his colleague from issuing a ticket, saying "Don't issue it, you will have to compensate them for the car after you issue it"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Contributions from netizens
On July 19, the Internet exposed an incident in which a teacher violently punished a student at Hengshui No. 2 Middle School in Hebei Province. In the video, the teacher beat the student with a ruler, kicked the student in the stomach, pushed and slapped the student.
It is reported that Hengshui No. 2 Middle School is known for its prison-like management system and intense teaching model. It is the second largest "super middle school" in Hebei.
In January this year, students from Hengshui No. 2 Middle School published an article online exposing the abuse of corporal punishment in the school and calling on all walks of life to "save us."
